intro: Actinocephalus nodifer, commonly known as the knotted actinocephalus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a creeping, hairy stem with numerous nodes, giving it its common name. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, and it produces small, oval seeds in a fluffy pappus. Actinocephalus nodifer is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
